12.text: Fungi play many important roles in the world's ecosystems and most of us actually carry

17.text: harmless fungal colonizers on our skin and in our digestive tracts.

21.text: But there is a dark side to fungi.

23.text: Every year more than one million people die from fungal infections.

28.text: That's more than those killed by malaria or breast cancer and almost

tuberculosis. On top of this staggering

available to doctors; and often

increasing with drug-resistant fungi

64.text: So why in the face of this global disease crisis haven't you heard of these hidden killers?

69.text: When others, like MRSA, SARS and Ebola regularly make headline news.

76.text: Thankfully a small but highly active research community are fighting back against the killer fungus.

118.text: Antibodies are being developed that can be used to treat infections and to

121.text: diagnose these infections early which will greatly improve patient survival.

126.text: We're also directly involved in training the next generation of scientists and

130.text: doctors to tackle fungal disease, not only here in the UK, but in developing

134.text: countries such as those in Africa, Asia and South America where the

142.text: Together, our research will help us to win the battle against the killer fungus.
